remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法和属性类通过公开的属性， ， ，并类。The methods and properties of the class are exposed through the property of the , , , and classes. 以下方法类仅在回发的方案中支持和不在异步回备份方案：The following methods of the class are supported only in post back scenarios and not in asynchronous post back scenarios: - - - - - - - - - - - 当你使用时启用部分页更新控件来更新选定的区域，而不是使用一种回发中更新整个页面的页面。Partial-page updates are enabled when you use controls to update selected regions of a page instead of updating the whole page with a post back. 有关详细信息，请参阅[UpdatePanel 控件概述](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/29a2265d-9674-4c19-b70e-e5560ee9689a)并[部分页呈现概述](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5c12736d-d9e9-464a-9388-3fe0f9f49e49)。For more information, see [UpdatePanel Control Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/29a2265d-9674-4c19-b70e-e5560ee9689a) and [Partial-Page Rendering Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5c12736d-d9e9-464a-9388-3fe0f9f49e49). ## Examples 请求页时，下面的示例绘制三个重叠的矩形。The following example draws three overlapping rectangles when the page is requested. 代码首先设置为 image/jpeg，属性，以便整个页面将呈现为 JPEG 图像。The code begins by setting the property to image/jpeg, so that the entire page will be rendered as a JPEG image. 然后，代码调用方法，以确保任何多余内容随此响应发送。The code then calls the method to ensure that no extraneous content is sent with this response. 接下来，代码会设置属性设置为 true，以便发送到请求的客户端之前完全处理页。Next, the code sets the property to true so that the page is completely processed before it is sent to the requesting client. 然后创建用于绘制矩形的两个对象：和一个对象。Two objects used to draw the rectangles are then created: a and a object. 在页中创建的变量用作坐标绘制矩形和最大的矩形内显示的字符串。The variables created in the page are used as coordinates to draw the rectangles and a string that appears inside the largest rectangle. 绘制了三个矩形和显示在其内部的字符串，当保存到与关联的对象属性，并且其格式设置为 JPEG。When the three rectangles and the string that appears inside them are drawn, the is saved to the object that is associated with the property and its format is set to JPEG. 该代码调用和方法以释放资源由两个图形对象。The code calls the and methods to release the resources used by the two drawing objects. 最后，该代码调用方法发送到请求的客户端缓冲的响应。Lastly, the code calls the method to send the buffered response to the requesting client. > [!NOTE] > 在代码中，的对象引用由关键字`Response`。In code, the object is referred to by the keyword `Response`. 例如，`Response.Clear()`是指方法。For example, `Response.Clear()` refers to the method. 类具有名为的属性的当前实例，该代理公开。The class has a property that is named that exposes the current instance of . remarks.format: ## Remarks 当项相对应的`cacheKey`从缓存中删除参数，当前项的缓存的响应无效。When the item corresponding to the `cacheKey` parameter is removed from the cache, the cached response of the current item is invalid. ## Examples 下面的示例是进行输出缓存的 ASP.NET 用户控件。The following example is an ASP.NET user control that is output cached. 控件调用的代码方法中存储的项的键对象作为其参数传递。The code for the control calls the method with the key of an item stored in the object passed as its parameter. 如果在缓存中不存在项，在输出缓存中存储的控件的响应将会失效。If the item does not exist in the cache, the control's response that was stored in the output cache is invalidated. 这意味着，在后续请求时，该控件的响应的新版本将添加到输出缓存。This means that on the subsequent request, a new version of the control's response will be added to the output cache. 接下来，代码检查某个项是否与相关联`bookData`密钥存储在`Cache`对象，并显示两行文本依赖于结果之一。Next, the code checks whether an item associated with a `bookData` key is stored in the `Cache` object, and displays one of two lines of text dependent upon the result. 然后，代码会设置的属性控件，它名为`dgBooks`，通过调用自定义`DataHelper`类的共享`GetBookData`方法，并填充与方法。Then, the code sets the property of a control, which is named `dgBooks`, with a call to a custom `DataHelper` class' shared `GetBookData` method, and populates the with the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > 如果本机模块第一次刷新响应意味着没有调用 AddOnSendingHeaders 方法。The AddOnSendingHeaders method is not invoked if the native module flushes the response first. 伪事件 OnSendingHeaders 与 IHttpModule 级别管道事件不同，因为它是每个请求订阅而不是每个应用程序订阅。The pseudo-event OnSendingHeaders differs from the IHttpModule-level pipeline event in that it is a per-request subscription rather than a per-application subscription. 其目的是回调可能会修改响应状态代码，或可能的响应 cookie 或标头设置。The intent is that the callback may modify the response status code or may set a response cookie or header. 其他用法注释和需要注意的问题：Other usage notes and caveats: - 仅当在集成的管道模式管道中运行 IIS 并且仅当尚未尚未响应标头发送当前请求的此方法非常有效。This method is effective only when IIS runs in integrated pipeline mode pipeline and only if response headers haven't yet been sent for the current request. - ASP.NET 运行时不保证在调用该回调的线程有关的任何信息。The ASP.NET runtime does not guarantee anything about the thread that the callback is invoked on. 例如，可能会调用回调以同步方式在后台线程中如果正在执行后台刷新。For example, the callback may be invoked synchronously in a background thread if a background flush is being performed. 不保证在此类线程中不可用。 is not guaranteed to be available in such a thread. - 回调必须调用的操作的响应实体正文或刷新过程中时得到任何方法。The callback must not call any method that manipulates the response entity body or that results in a flush. 例如，回调必须调用，因为该方法可能操作的响应实体正文。For example, the callback must not call , as that method may manipulate the response entity body. - 回调必须包含短时间运行的同步代码。The callback must contain only short-running synchronous code. 尝试调用异步操作或等待此类操作可能导致死锁。Attempting to invoke an asynchronous operation or wait on such an operation could result in a deadlock. - 回调不会引发异常;否则行为是不确定的。The callback must not throw an exception; otherwise behavior is undefined.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果您使用方法来发送特定于缓存的标头在同一时间使用的缓存对象模型 () 以设置缓存策略，适用于缓存的 HTTP 响应标头 (`Cache-Control`， `Expires`， `Last-Modified`， `Pragma`，和`Vary`) 使用的缓存对象模型时可能会被删除。If you use the method to send cache-specific headers and at the same time use the cache object model () to set cache policy, HTTP response headers that pertain to caching (`Cache-Control`, `Expires`, `Last-Modified`, `Pragma`, and `Vary`) might be deleted when the cache object model is used. 此行为使 ASP.NET 能够维护限制性最强的设置。This behavior enables ASP.NET to maintain the most restrictive settings. 例如，考虑包括用户控件的页面。For example, consider a page that includes user controls. 如果这些控件具有冲突的缓存策略，将使用限制性最强的缓存策略。If those controls have conflicting cache policies, the most restrictive cache policy will be used. 如果一个用户控件设置的标头"`Cache-Control: Public`"和另一个用户控件设置的限制性更强的标头"`Cache-Control: Private`"通过调用，则"`Cache-Control: Private`"标头将发送响应。If one user control sets the header "`Cache-Control: Public`" and another user control sets the more restrictive header "`Cache-Control: Private`" via calls to , then the "`Cache-Control: Private`" header will be sent with the response. 标准 http/1.1 标头的列表，请参阅第 14，"标头字段定义"节中[超文本传输协议-HTTP/1.1](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=73147) World Wide Web 联合会 (W3C) 网站上的规范。For a list of standard HTTP/1.1 headers, see section 14, "Header Field Definitions," in the [Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=73147) specification on the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site. ## Examples 下面的示例调用方法添加到自定义标头对象发送到请求的客户端。The following example calls the method to add a custom header to the object sent to the requesting client. [!code-csharp[System.Web.HttpResponse.AppendHeader_Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.HttpResponse.AppendHeader_Example/CS/responseappendheader.cs.aspx#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.HttpResponse.AppendHeader_Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.HttpResponse.AppendHeader_Example/VB/responseappendheader.vb.aspx#1)]

span.span: Adds custom log information to the Internet Information Services (IIS) log file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要允许记录在日志文件中的指定字符串，首先必须启用**URI 查询**的选项**扩展日志记录属性**你想要的活动记录在 IIS 中的站点对话框.To allow for the specified string to be recorded in the log file, you first must enable the **URI Query** option of the **Extended Logging Properties** dialog box for the site that you want to log activity for in IIS. 若要自定义扩展中的日志记录 IIS 6.0，请执行以下步骤：To customize extended logging in IIS 6.0, follow these steps: 1. 在 IIS 管理器中，展开本地计算机节点，展开 Web 或 FTP 站点文件夹，右键单击 Web 或 FTP 站点，然后单击**属性**。In IIS Manager, expand the local computer node, expand the Web or FTP Sites folder, right-click the Web or FTP site, and then click **Properties**. 2. 单击**Web 或 FTP 站点**选项卡，然后选择**启用日志记录**复选框 （如果尚未选择）。Click the **Web or FTP Site** tab, and then select the **Enable logging** check box (if it is not already selected). 3. 在中**活动的日志格式**框中，单击**W3C 扩展日志文件格式**。In the **Active log format** box, click **W3C Extended Log File Format**. 4. 单击**属性**。Click **Properties**. 5. 单击**高级**选项卡上，选择你想要登录，然后单击属性**确定**。Click the **Advanced** tab, select the properties that you want to log, and then click **OK**. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何将一个字符串追加到日志。The following example shows how to append a string to the log. MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ClientDisconnectedToken As CancellationToken
public: property System::Threading::CancellationToken ClientDisconnectedToken { System::Threading::CancellationToken get(); };

summary.span: Gets a object that is tripped when the client disconnects.

span.span: Gets a object that is tripped when the client disconnects.

value.span: 取消标记。

span.span: The cancellation token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此 API 是线程安全的。This API is thread-safe. 但是，有一些限制应如何使用取消标记。However, there are some restrictions on how the cancellation token should be used. 未正确使用可能会导致争用条件、 死锁或其他意外的行为。Using it incorrectly can lead to race conditions, deadlocks, or other unexpected behavior. 请记住以下准则：Keep in mind the following guidelines: - 确保不调用此 api 边界外的单个请求，因为 ASP.NET 将释放请求结束时的取消标记。Ensure that you don't call into this API outside the bounds of a single request, because ASP.NET will dispose of the cancellation token at the end of the request. 就释放之前，该令牌曾经将转换为已取消状态不能保证。There is no guarantee that the token will ever transition to a canceled state before it is disposed. 例如，如果在请求完成而无需具有断开连接的客户端，该令牌将被释放而无需首先具有已取消。For example, if the request finishes without the client having disconnected, the token will be disposed without having first been canceled. - 不等待，如这异步通知的初衷背道而驰，并且会导致死锁。Do not wait on the , as this defeats the purpose of an asynchronous notification and can cause deadlocks. - 不要调用重载调用的回调在原始对象。Do not call the overloads which invoke the callback on the original object. - 不要使用对象或其他非线程安全 ASP.NET 固有对象从在回调中提供给方法。Do not use the object or other non-thread-safe ASP.NET intrinsic objects from within the callback provided to the method. 回调可能与其他 ASP.NET 同时运行或应用程序代码。The callback may be running concurrently with other ASP.NET or application code. - 保留的短时间运行的回调方法和非阻塞。Keep the callback methods short-running and non-blocking. - 请尽量避免引发异常从回调方法中。Make every effort to avoid throwing exceptions from within the callback methods. 在 Internet 信息服务 (IIS) 7.5 或更高版本在集成模式下仅支持此属性。This property is only supported in Internet Information Service (IIS) 7.5 or higher in integrated mode. 如果调用的正确 IIS 版本或管道模式不，引发。If you invoke it without the right IIS version or pipeline mode, a is thrown. 若要确定 IIS 版本，请使用。To determine the IIS version, use . 若要确定管道模式，请使用。To determine the pipeline mode, use .

summary.span: Closes the socket connection to a client.

span.span: Closes the socket connection to a client.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法以突然发生的方式将终止与客户端的连接，不适合进行常规的 HTTP 请求处理。This method terminates the connection to the client in an abrupt manner and is not intended for normal HTTP request processing. 该方法将重置数据包发送到客户端，这可能导致上服务器、 客户端，或在某处之间删除响应进行缓冲处理的数据。The method sends a reset packet to the client, which can cause response data that is buffered on the server, the client, or somewhere in between to be dropped. 但是，通常应调用改为如果你想要跳转到事件并发送到客户端的响应。However, typically you should call instead if you want to jump ahead to the event and send a response to the client.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ASP.NET 包括两个内部 cookie 集合。ASP.NET includes two intrinsic cookie collections. 通过访问的集合的集合包含传输中的服务器到客户端的 cookie`Cookie`标头。The collection accessed through the collection of contains cookies transmitted by the client to the server in the `Cookie` header. 通过访问的集合的集合包含在服务器上创建和传输到客户端中的新 cookie`Set-Cookie`标头。The collection accessed through the collection of contains new cookies created on the server and transmitted to the client in the `Set-Cookie` header. 使用添加 cookie 后集合，cookie 可立即在集合，即使尚未发送到客户端响应。After you add a cookie by using the collection, the cookie is immediately available in the collection, even if the response has not been sent to the client. ## Examples 下面的示例创建名为的新 cookie `LastVisit`、 的 cookie 的值设置为当前日期和时间，并将该 cookie 添加到当前的 cookie 集合。The following example creates a new cookie named `LastVisit`, sets the value of the cookie to the current date and time, and adds the cookie to the current cookie collection. Cookie 集合中的所有 cookie 都发送到客户端在`Set-Cookie`标头的 HTTP 输出流。All cookies in the cookie collection are sent to the client in the `Set-Cookie` header with the HTTP output stream. remarks.format: ## Remarks 提供此方法是仅与 ASP 的兼容性，即与前面带有 ASP.NET 的基于 COM 的 Web 编程技术的兼容性。This method is provided only for compatibility with ASP - that is, for compatibility with COM-based Web-programming technology that preceded ASP.NET. 如果你想要跳转到事件并发送到客户端的响应，通常最好是调用相反。If you want to jump ahead to the event and send a response to the client, it is usually preferable to call instead. 若要模拟的行为`End`ASP 中的方法，此方法尝试引发异常。To mimic the behavior of the `End` method in ASP, this method tries to raise a exception. 如果此尝试成功，将中止调用线程，这是对站点的性能造成不利影响。If this attempt is successful, the calling thread will be aborted, which is detrimental to your site's performance. 在这种情况下，在调用任何代码执行方法。In that case, no code after the call to the method is executed. 如果方法不能引发，而是将响应字节数刷新到客户端。If the method is not able to raise a , it instead flushes the response bytes to the client. 这是以同步方式，也可以是对站点的性能造成不利影响。It does this synchronously, which can also be detrimental to your site's performance. 在任一情况下 (是否成功引发异常)，响应管道将向前跳到事件。In either case (whether or not a exception is successfully raised), the response pipeline jumps ahead to the event. 方法不会引发异常，并在调用后的代码方法可能会执行。The method does not raise an exception, and code after the call to the method might be executed. 如果您的意图是为了避免执行的后续代码，并且对性能的影响是可以接受的可以调用而不是。If your intention is to avoid execution of subsequent code, and if the performance penalty of is acceptable, you can call instead of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当您创建`Stream`对象并设置属性设置为`Stream`对象，所有 HTTP 输出发送通过筛选器。When you create a `Stream` object and set the property to the `Stream` object, all HTTP output sent by passes through the filter. ## Examples 下面的示例是 ASP.NET 页的设置属性设置为的新实例`UpperCaseFilter`类中，自定义将转换为大写形式将通过此模块的所有文本的类。The following example is an ASP.NET page that sets the property to a new instance of the `UpperCaseFilter` class, a custom class that converts all text that passes through it to uppercase. 有关请求的信息保存到文本文件，然后属性设置。The information about the request is saved to a text file, and then the property is set. 响应筛选器准备就绪后，该代码调用方法来获取名为的文本文件的绝对路径`TestFile.txt`用作响应内容的源。After the response filter is in place, the code calls the method to get the absolute path to a text file named `TestFile.txt` that serves as the source for the content of the response. 该代码随后创建一个新对象，以便从开始到结束，然后调用读取文本文件方法来显示页面上的文件的内容。The code then creates a new object to read the text file from beginning to end, and then calls the method to display the content of the file on the page. remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性可让您能够禁用或更改对象上使用的响应标头， ， ，或对象。The property gives you the ability to disable or change the object on a response header by using the , , , or object. 默认编码值是类。The default encoding value is the class. 通过更改的类型属性，可能会延长特定恶意攻击或原因通过响应标头发送敏感数据的风险。By changing the type of the property, you can potentially increase the risk of certain malicious attacks or cause sensitive data to be sent through the response header. 标头注入攻击，可以避免，部分，通过保留属性的默认设置的响应。Header injection attacks can be avoided, in part, by leaving the property of a response to the default setting. 对易受攻击的应用程序的攻击可能回显导致将受信任的数据作为响应标头的一部分。An attack against a vulnerable application could echo back entrusted data as part of a response header. 如果延续行的标头中或如果任何标头构造基于不受信任数据的结果，应发送到响应流之前验证标头数据，一项要求已禁用。If the is disabled because of a requirement for continuation lines in a header or if any header is constructed based on the result of untrusted data, the header data should be validated before sending to the response stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性返回`false`满足以下条件时：The property returns `false` when the following conditions are true: - 向客户端连接已终止。The connection to the client was terminated. 发生这种情况调用方法时，或如果客户端停止 Web 页的执行，或浏览到另一页。This can occur if the method was invoked, or if the client stopped execution of the Web page or browsed to another page. - 处理请求的对象是`null`或方法将返回`false`。The object that is handling the request is `null` or the method returns `false`. 如果自定义对象将处理请求，则方法可能会基于设置自定义条件。If a custom object handles the request, then the method might be set based on custom criteria. 例如，自定义辅助角色请求可能会在一段时间后强制超时。For example, the custom worker request might force a time-out after a period of time. ## Examples 下面的示例使用属性检查是否正在请求页的客户端仍连接到服务器。The following example uses the property to check whether the client that is requesting the page remains connected to the server. 如果为 true，该代码调用方法，并在客户端将查看另一页。If is true, the code calls the method, and the client will view another page. 如果为 false，则该代码调用方法，并且所有页面处理会终止。If is false, then the code calls the method and all page processing is terminated. remarks.format: ## Remarks Internet 内容所选内容 (PICS) 平台是内容标记的 World Wide Web 联合会 (W3C) 标准。Platform for Internet Content Selection (PICS) is a World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) standard for content labeling. 照片图像是实质上是一种用于创建分级系统的语言。PICS is essentially a language for creating a ratings system. 任何值可以是 PICS 标签;ASP.NET 不会验证标签。Any value can be a PICS label; ASP.NET does not validate the label. 字符串的最大长度为 255 个字符。The maximum length of the string is 255 characters. 有关 PICS 标准和语法的详细信息，请参阅[World Wide Web Consortium](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=37125) Web 站点。For more information about PICS standards and syntax, see the [World Wide Web Consortium](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=37125) Web site. ## Examples 下面的示例是显示图像的 ASP.NET 页。The following example is an ASP.NET page that displays an image. 该页的代码调用方法以设置 HTTP`PICS-Label`响应的标头。The page code calls the method to set the HTTP `PICS-Label` header for the response. 作为参数传递的字符串方法表示 Internet 内容分级关联 (ICRA) 网站上生成的评分标签。The string that is passed as the parameter to the method represents a rating label generated from the Internet Content Rating Association (ICRA) Web site. remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用等效于调用第二个参数设置为`true`。Calling is equivalent to calling with the second parameter set to `true`. 调用该类会引发完成后的异常。 calls which throws a exception upon completion. 此异常有不利的影响对 Web 应用程序性能。This exception has a detrimental effect on Web application performance. 因此，我们建议，而不是此重载使用重载，并传递`false`有关`endResponse`参数，然后再调用方法。Therefore, we recommend that instead of this overload you use the overload and pass `false` for the `endResponse` parameter, and then call the method. 有关更多信息，请参见 方法。For more information, see the method. > [!NOTE] > 移动页仅，如果你的应用程序依赖无 cookie 会话，或从移动设备需要的无 cookie 会话可能会收到请求，使用波形符 (\~) 的路径中可能会导致创建新的会话，并有可能丢失会话数据。For mobile pages only, if your application relies on cookieless sessions, or might receive requests from mobile devices that require cookieless sessions, using a tilde (\~) in a path can result in creating a new session and potentially losing session data. 如使用路径移动控件上设置属性"\~/path"，路径使用解析"\~/path"之前将其分配给该属性。To set a property on a mobile control with a path such as "\~/path", resolve the path using "\~/path" before assigning it to the property. ASP.NET 执行通过返回 HTTP 状态代码为 302 重定向。ASP.NET performs the redirection by returning a 302 HTTP status code. 将控制转移到另一页的替代方法是方法。An alternative way to transfer control to another page is the method. 方法是通常效率更高，因为它不会一次往返过程导致向客户端。The method is typically more efficient because it does not cause a round trip to the client. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：将用户重定向到另一页](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/daef3f43-e018-43aa-b43c-46b27bac599e)。For more information, see [How to: Redirect Users to Another Page](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/daef3f43-e018-43aa-b43c-46b27bac599e). ## Examples 下面的示例强制无条件重定向到另一个 Web 站点。The following example forces an unconditional redirection to another Web site. remarks.format: ## Remarks 绝对 URL (例如， `http://www.contoso.com/default.aspx`) 或相对 URL (例如，Default.aspx) 可为指定的目标位置，但某些浏览器可能会拒绝的相对 URL。An absolute URL (for example, `http://www.contoso.com/default.aspx`) or a relative URL (for example, Default.aspx) can be specified for the target location but some browsers may reject a relative URL. 当你使用此方法在页处理程序中一页，并开始新请求的另一页，设置的终止请求`endResponse`到`false`，然后调用方法。When you use this method in a page handler to terminate a request for one page and start a new request for another page, set `endResponse` to `false` and then call the method. 如果指定`true`有关`endResponse`参数，此方法调用原始请求，将引发方法操作完成时的异常。If you specify `true` for the `endResponse` parameter, this method calls the method for the original request, which throws a exception when it completes. 此异常有不利的影响对 Web 应用程序性能，这就是原因传递`false`为`endResponse`建议参数。This exception has a detrimental effect on Web application performance, which is why passing `false` for the `endResponse` parameter is recommended. 有关更多信息，请参见 方法。For more information, see the method. > [!NOTE] > 移动页，如果你的应用程序依赖无 cookie 会话，或从移动设备需要的无 cookie 会话可能会收到请求，使用波形符 (\~) 路径可在创建新的会话和有可能会丢失会话数据。For mobile pages, if your application relies on cookieless sessions, or might receive requests from mobile devices that require cookieless sessions, using a tilde (\~) in a path can create a new session and potentially lose session data. 如使用路径移动控件上设置属性"\~/path"，路径使用解析"\~/path"之前将其分配给该属性。To set a property on a mobile control with a path such as "\~/path", resolve the path using "\~/path" before assigning it to the property. ASP.NET 执行通过返回 HTTP 状态代码为 302 重定向。ASP.NET performs the redirection by returning a 302 HTTP status code. 将控制转移到另一页的替代方法是方法。An alternative way to transfer control to another page is the method. 方法是通常效率更高，因为它不会一次往返过程导致向客户端。The method is typically more efficient because it does not cause a round trip to the client. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：将用户重定向到另一页](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/daef3f43-e018-43aa-b43c-46b27bac599e)。For more information, see [How to: Redirect Users to Another Page](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/daef3f43-e018-43aa-b43c-46b27bac599e). ## Examples 下面的示例使用属性检查是否正在请求页的客户端仍连接到服务器。The following example uses the property to check whether the client that is requesting the page remains connected to the server. 如果为 true，该代码调用方法，并在客户端将查看另一页。If is true, the code calls the method, and the client will view another page. 如果为 false，则该代码调用方法，并且所有页面处理会终止。If is false, then the code calls the method and all page processing is terminated. span.span: to suppress the default Cache Control: private header for the current HTTP response; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下，ASP.NET 将发送`Cache-Control: private`响应标头除非已为此响应指定显式的缓存策略。By default, ASP.NET sends a `Cache-Control: private` response header unless an explicit cache policy has been specified for this response. 此属性，可禁止显示此默认响应标头基于每个请求。This property allows suppressing this default response header on a per-request basis. 标头仍为整个应用程序通过设置抑制中[httpRuntime 元素 （ASP.NET 设置架构）](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e9b81350-8aaf-47cc-9843-5f7d0c59f369)或[（ASP.NET 设置架构）caching的outputCache元素](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/47cd2b47-316f-4dfd-bbf8-539be3066fee).The header can still be suppressed for the entire application by setting in [httpRuntime Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e9b81350-8aaf-47cc-9843-5f7d0c59f369) or [outputCache Element for caching (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/47cd2b47-316f-4dfd-bbf8-539be3066fee). 取消显示默认值时要格外小心`Cache-Control: private`标头为代理和其他中间方可能会将响应而无需此标头视为可缓存默认情况下。Use caution when suppressing the default `Cache-Control: private` header, as proxies and other intermediaries may treat responses without this header as cacheable by default. 此种处理方式可能会导致意外的缓存的敏感信息。This treatment can lead to the inadvertent caching of sensitive information. 请参阅[RFC 2616 第秒 13.4](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616)有关详细信息。See [RFC 2616, Sec. 13.4](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616) for more information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下，窗体身份验证转换为 HTTP 401 状态代码 302 重定向到登录页。By default, forms authentication converts HTTP 401 status codes to 302 in order to redirect to the login page. 这并不适合某些类别的错误，例如当身份验证成功，但授权失败，或当前的请求时是 AJAX 或 web 服务请求。This isn't appropriate for certain classes of errors, such as when authentication succeeds but authorization fails, or when the current request is an AJAX or web service request. 此属性提供了一种方法来取消重定向行为，并将原始的状态代码发送到客户端。This property provides a way to suppress the redirect behavior and send the original status code to the client.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果从客户端接收或传输到客户端时，未通过验证从 Web 客户端接收的输入，动态生成的 HTML 页面可能会引入安全风险。Dynamically generated HTML pages can introduce security risks if input received from Web clients is not validated either when it is received from a client or when it is transmitted back to a client. 输入提交到 Web 站点并随后写回给客户端中嵌入的恶意脚本可能看上去来自受信任的源。Malicious script that is embedded in input submitted to a Web site and later written back out to a client can appear to be originating from a trusted source. 此安全风险被称为跨站点脚本攻击。This security risk is referred to as a cross-site scripting attack. 您应始终验证时它会将传输从你的站点到客户端浏览器从客户端收到的数据。You should always validate data that is received from a client when it will be transmitted from your site to client browsers. 此外，每当收到作为输入的任何数据以 HTML 的形式写出时，您应该对其进行编码使用一种技术，如或防止执行恶意脚本。Moreover, whenever you write out as HTML any data that was received as input, you should encode it using a technique such as or to prevent malicious script from executing. 此方法可用于收到它时未进行验证的数据。This technique is useful for data that was not validated when it was received. 在编码或筛选数据时，必须指定为您的 Web 页面设置，以便你的筛选器可以识别并删除不属于的设置 （如非字母数字序列），可能会产生恶意脚本中嵌入任何字节序列的字符它们。When you encode or filter data, you must specify a character set for your Web pages so that your filter can identify and remove any byte sequences that do not belong to that set (such as nonalphanumeric sequences) and could potentially have malicious script embedded in them. 有关跨站点脚本攻击的详细信息，请参阅文章 Q252985，"如何为防止跨站点脚本安全问题"上[Microsoft 知识库文章](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=37115)Web 站点。For more information about cross-site scripting attacks, see article Q252985, "How to Prevent Cross-Site Scripting Security Issues" on the [Microsoft Knowledge Base](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=37115) Web site. ## Examples 下面的示例将回显到客户端的浏览器的客户端的名称。The following example echoes the client's name back to the client's browser. 方法中去除任何恶意脚本和提交中的无效字符`UserName`输入的字段。The method strips any malicious script and invalid characters that may have been submitted in the `UserName` input field. remarks.format: ## Remarks 当此方法用于大型文件时，调用该方法可能引发异常。When this method is used with large files, calling the method might throw an exception. 可以使用此方法使用的文件的大小取决于 Web 服务器的硬件配置。The size of the file that can be used with this method depends on the hardware configuration of the Web server. 有关详细信息，参见位于，"PRB:Response.WriteFile 无法下载大型文件"上[Microsoft 知识库文章](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=149903)Web 站点。For more information, see article 812406, "PRB: Response.WriteFile Cannot Download a Large File" on the [Microsoft Knowledge Base](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=149903) Web site. ## Examples 下面的示例将一个名为文本文件的所有内容都写入`Login.txt`（其中可能包含文本的 HTML 文本和输入控件） 直接向输出流。The following example writes all the contents of a text file named `Login.txt` (which might contain literal HTML text and input controls) directly to the output stream. remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以使用在输出缓存的页面中的缓存后替换的方法。You can use the method for post-cache substitution in your output-cached pages. 通过传递对象到回调方法，具有规定签名，您可以替换缓存的输出内容的页面缓存中任何给定位置。By passing a object to a callback method with a prescribed signature, you can replace output cached content at any given location in the page cache. 若要开始替换，调用方法，并向其传递回调方法，它必须是线程安全并可以是以下之一：To initiate the replacement, call the method, passing it the callback method, which must be thread safe and can be either of the following: - 容器页或用户控件上的静态方法。A static method on the container page or user control. - 静态或实例方法对另一个任意对象。A static or instance method on another arbitrary object. 在页上，对第一个请求上调用委托以生成输出。On the first request to the page, the calls the delegate to produce the output. 然后，它将替换缓冲区添加到响应，以保留要在今后的请求调用的委托。Then, it adds a substitution buffer to the response, which retains the delegate to call on future requests. 最后，它会降低客户端的可缓存性从公开为仅服务器不在客户端上缓存来确保以后对页重新调用的请求委托。Finally, it degrades client-side cacheability from public to server-only, ensuring future requests to the page re-invoke the delegate by not caching on the client. > [!NOTE] > 缓存后替换不支持缓存的用户控件的输出缓存用户控件级别应用。Post-cache substitution is not supported for a cached user control where output caching is applied at the user control level. 这也称为分段缓存。This is also known as fragment caching. 有关详细信息，请参阅[缓存的 ASP.NET 页面的某些部分](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/cdd8e523-7305-4685-a456-c5be1de1367e)。For more information, see [Caching Portions of an ASP.NET Page](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/cdd8e523-7305-4685-a456-c5be1de1367e).
